description: Roman numerals with 1 letter, in numerical order; then those with 2 letters, etc.
example: Written in Roman, the sequence reads: I, V, X, L, C, D, M, II, IV, VI, IX, XI, XV, XX, XL, LI, LV, LX, XC, CI, CV, CX, CL, CC, CD, DI, DV, DX, DL, DC, CM, MI, MV, MX, MV, MC, MD, MM, III, VII, XII, ... - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 12 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _J. H. Conway_ and John Jackson (ab158(AT)freenet.uchsc.edu)
extensions: More terms from _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 12 2015
